alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 05 at 2:57PM PDT until August 05 at 7:00PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southern California, including the following county, San Diego. * WHEN...Until 600 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 257 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hwy 78 Between S2 And Borrego Springs Rd, Borrego Springs, Hwy 78 Between Banner And S2, Hwy 78 Between Borrego Springs Rd And Ocotillo Wells, Hwy S22 Between Ranchita And Borrego Springs, Ranchita, Borrego Palm Canyon, Hwy S2 Between Shelter Valley And Agua Caliente, Hwy S2 Between Hwy 79 And Hwy 78, Fish Creek Wash, Warner Springs, Shelter Valley and Los Coyotes Indian Reservation. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
